1.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who was the master of a household and who went out early in the morning to hire laborers for his vineyard.

2.text: After agreeing with the laborers for a [salary of one] denarius a day, he sent them into his vineyard.

3.text: [Later], he went out when it was about the third hour and saw other men standing idle in the marketplace.

4.text: He told them, ‘You too should go into the vineyard, and I will pay you whatever is right.’ And so, they went their way.

5.text: Again, he went out when it was about the sixth and the ninth hour, and did the same thing.

6.text: About the eleventh hour, he went out and still found others standing idle. He asked them, ‘Why do you stand here all day, doing nothing?’

7.text: They said to him, ‘Because no one has hired us!’ The master told them, ‘You too should go into the vineyard, and you will receive whatever is right.’

8.text: When evening came, the lord of the vineyard said to his manager, ‘Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.’

9.text: When those who were hired at about the eleventh hour came, they each received a denarius.

10.text: Now when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more, but they each likewise received one denarius.

11.text: When they received it, they grumbled against the master of the household,

12.text: saying: ‘These last [workers] have spent one hour, and yet you have made them equal to us, who have borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat!’

13.text: But the master answered one of them and said, ‘Friend, I am doing you no wrong! Did you not agree with me for one denarius?

14.text: Take what is yours, and go your way. What if I wish to give to this last one just as much as to you!

15.text: Is it not lawful for me to do what I want with what I own? Or is your eye evil, because I am good?’

16.text: And so, the last will be first, and the first last!  Indeed, many are called, but few are chosen.”

17.text: As Jesus was going up to Jerusalem, he took the Twelve disciples aside on the way, and said to them,

18.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death,

19.text: and they will hand him over to the Gentiles to mock, scourge and crucify him. And on the third day, he will rise again.”

20.text: Then the mother of the sons of Zebedee came to him with her sons, kneeling and asking a certain thing of him.

21.text: He said to her, “What do you want?” She said to him, “Command that these, my two sons, may sit, one on your right hand, and one on your left hand, in your Kingdom.”

22.text: But Jesus answered, “You do not know what you are asking! Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink,  or be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”  They said to him, “We are able!”

23.text: Jesus answered, “You will indeed drink my cup and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with, but to sit on my right hand and on my left, this is not mine to give! It is [reserved] for whom it has been prepared by my Father.”

24.text: When the ten heard [about] this, they were upset with the two brothers.

25.text: However, Jesus called them together and said, “You know that the rulers of the nations lord it over them, and great ones make their authority felt.

26.text: But it shall not be so among you! Instead, whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.

27.text: Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your slave,

28.text: even as the Son of Man came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”

29.text: As they were leaving Jericho, a great crowd was following Jesus.

30.text: Behold, two blind men were sitting by the road, and when they heard that Jesus was passing by, they cried out, “Lord, have mercy on us, son of David!”

31.text: The crowd rebuked them and told them to be quiet, but the blind men cried out even more, “Lord, have mercy on us, son of David!”

32.text: Jesus stood still and called them, asking, “What do you want me to do for you?”

33.text: They told him, “Lord, that our eyes may be opened!”

34.text: Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes, and immediately their eyes received their sight, and they began to follow him.
